Pre-Game Insights: Lee Carsley intends to return to a more familiar system against Finland in the Nations League on Sunday.
Carsley went with an attacking 4-2-4 system against Greece, which struggled for cohesion and defensive security.
Harry Kane missed the match against Greece due to a minor groin problem but is hoping to return in Helsinki.
Carsley emphasized the need for a reaction against Finland after the defeat to Greece.
Carsley plans to make changes to his starting XI against Finland, with Kyle Walker and Marc Guéhi in contention to return.
Kane trained on Friday, and some players expect him to feature in Helsinki.
Post-Match Reflections: Carsley took responsibility for the defeat to Greece, acknowledging that the tactical plan was a backfire.
Carsley expressed his belief in the team despite the setback and emphasized the importance of leading by example.
Carsley mentioned that the performance against Greece has changed the narrative around his potential permanent appointment as England manager.
